description:
En tant que chargé de gestion de l'information et veille stratégique, votre mission consiste à apporter du support à l'équipe en termes d'identification, collecte, traitement, analyse et mise à disposition d'informations de marchés ainsi qu'à accompagner et fournir de l'information et des services de veille stratégique à valeur ajoutée aux clients internes (salariés du groupe Orange). Il s'agira notamment de
Produire de la veille sur les secteurs associés aux activités des Telcos et de l'écosystème numérique
Gérer la qualité des flux et du contenu des sources d'information achetées
Qualifier les sources d'information pour une meilleure mise à disposition: enrichissement, mise à jour, accessibilité, évaluation
Rechercher, traiter, analyser, et diffuser des informations clés
Rédiger des synthèses, dossiers, notes et newsletters d'actualité des marchés étudiés
Réponse aux Questions/Réponses demandées par les marketeurs et business analystes d'Orange
Participer à la production de la lettre de veille hebdomadaire
Participer au chantier de transformation des outils de veille pour intégrer les dernières technologies du secteur
Proposer des améliorations du processus de veille
Impulser des nouveaux mode de fonctionnement
Alimenter l'analyse des nouveaux portefeuilles d'innovation
Proposer des nouveaux formats de veille (vidéo, podcast, one page….)
about you
De formation supérieure en Management et Gestion Stratégique de l'Information et des Technologies (ou école de commerce) vous avez une appétence pour les nouvelles technologies et le secteur des Telecoms.

Votre capacité à travailler aussi bien de façon autonome qu'en équipe sont des éléments clés pour ce poste.

Vous avez une très bonne connaissance des étapes clés d'un processus de veille stratégie (Collecte, Traitement, Analyse, Diffusion…) ainsi que des outils associés. Votre rigueur, organisation et capacité de synthèse seront des atouts clés dans la réussite de votre mission.
La pratique de l'anglais comme langue de travail fréquente nécessite un très bon niveau oral et écrit.
Doté(e) d'une bonne culture générale, vous devrez également faire preuve de curiosité, d'ouverture d'esprit, de d'aisance rédactionnelle et à communiquer, de sens collectif, d'autonomie et d'initiative.
additional information
Au sein de la direction de la stratégie d'Innovation d'Orange, vous intégrerez l'équipe qui gère la veille marché et des tendances émergentes afin d'éclairer et d'accompagner les innovateurs d'Orange dans l'exploration business de leurs sujets.
Vous aurez donc l'occasion avec le support de toute l'équipe, de travailler sur des thématiques diverses et avec des interlocuteurs variés au sein du Groupe Orange.
Votre esprit collaboratif, votre disponibilité et votre engagement, vous permettra de participer à des dossiers clés pour l'innovation en apportant votre savoir faire d'analyse et de veille marché.
department
Dans un contexte d'évolutions rapides des usages et attentes clients, de ruptures technologiques, de concurrence croissante de nouveaux acteurs et de nouveaux modèles économiques, la Division Technology and Global innovation d'Orange (TGI) a pour mission de prépare le futur d'Orange avec les pays et nos écosystèmes en construisant des atouts compétitifs différenciant. Cette mission s'articule autour de 4 axes :
Porter la stratégie technologique et data du Groupe
Piloter les innovations majeures
Accompagner les pays dans leur démarche d'innovation
Construire et opérer des solutions mutualisées.

Au sein de TGI, c'est la direction de la Stratégie d'Innovation qui porte le premier axe et qui gère notamment l'activité de veille stratégique afin de :
Mutualiser les achats d'études de veille stratégique,
Informer et garantir l'accès à ces études et leur disponibilité permanente,
Accompagner ses clients internes et leur offrir des services de veille à valeur ajoutée.

Cette activité de veilles stratégique se décompose en 4 actions :
Analyse, veille concurrentielle et stratégique,
Information et documentation,
Gestion de plateforme online
Gestion des commandes et suivi des fournisseurs et co-financeurs.

La plateforme online de veille stratégique agrège aujourd'hui plusieurs milliers d'utilisateurs francophones et non-francophones. Ce site, ouvert à tout le Groupe Orange, est alimenté en études de veille stratégique achetées auprès des meilleurs fournisseurs du marché et d'analyses réalisées par l'équipe elle-même
contract

description:
Société : PapernestDescription
Nous, c’est papernest.

Nous avons un rêve, celui d’un monde sans paperasse. Un monde où les phobiques administratifs comme nous vivent enfin protégés de l'angoisse du formulaire et des majorations pour retard de paiement.

Par contre, on ne va pas te mentir, il y a du boulot. C’est pourquoi nous cherchons des personnes investies, créatives et hyper enthousiastes comme toi pour nous accompagner dans l’aventure.

Car depuis 2015, nous n’avons pas chômé. Avec 3.5 millions de déménagements par an en France, et 76% des Français qui se disent stressés par l’événement, nous avons décidé d’attaquer le sujet en commençant par cette opportunité là. Résultat : nous avons créé la seule plateforme qui permet de transférer tous ses contrats lors d’un déménagement, 100% gratuitement, 100% en ligne. A l’heure où nous soufflons notre 3ème bougie, nous sommes plus de 200 collaborateurs, avons accompagné plus de 200 000 utilisateurs, et avons ouvert un bureau à Barcelone.

Nous voyons les choses en grand : une équipe bouillonnante d'idées aux quatre coins du globe, un avenir où notre entière vie administrative est mise à portée de clic.

Pour relever ces défis, nous recrutons un/e Sales Analyst & Operations Manager. Un beau challenge expliqué par la Harvard Business Review : https://hbr.org/2014/12/why-sales-ops-is-so-hard

Tes missions
Structurer les équipes d'Account Management (6 personnes entre Paris et Barcelone)
Définir le tunnel d’acquisition des agences immobilières : transition, relance, closing, ...
Aider au pilotage de la stratégie de rétention des agences immobilières via les reportings et KPIs des canaux en étant garant de la fiabilité de la data
Définir et mettre en place les workflows et automatisation adéquats
Optimiser le taux de rétention des AM (et trouver les moyens pour le doubler- whatever that means)
Analyse de la structure de rémunération et modification pour incentiver les bons comportements
Au quotidien, il faudra être capable de travailler avec notre équipe de pros du domaine : Data Analysts, Product Manager Agences Immos, CRM Manager, Développeurs, … Requirements Profil recherché
Issu(e) d’une top école d’ingénieur ou de commerce
Analytique et très à l'aise avec Excel, Slides. SQL est un plus (mais on peut aussi te l'apprendre)
Grande empathie : tu es capable de te mettre aussi bien dans la peau d'un account manager que dans celui d'un developpeur
Naturellement, tu sais convaincre sans imposer tes idées frontalement
Hyper rigoureux(se), débrouillard(e), résilient !
Tu raisonnes en KPIs clairs et pas en vanity metrics : Nombre d’Agences signées, Leads envoyés par agence ou agent, Churn, Upsell sont des metrics que tu regardes tous les matins
Ton éventuelle connaissance des outils CRM (Hubspot, Salesforce) et d’analyses (Excel, BigQuery, DataStudio) te permettront mieux assurer le fonctionnement de toute l’équipe ! Benefits Tu vas apprendre :
Le SQL et mastériser des compétences analytiques
A gérer des projets touchant à une multitude d'équipes (sales, am, product manager, designers...)
A créer, structurer et mettre en place des process pour améliorer nos KPIs
Animer des réunions et améliorer tes compétences en public speaking (tu en animerais une demi-douzaine par mois)
Ton manager sera Stanislas, notre BtoB Growth Lead & Product Owner. Fin stratège, ce parisien qui a grandit entre le Canada et l'Australie saura jouer ses meilleurs atouts pour décupler la croissance fulgurante des équipes BtoB de papernest.

Explorateur dans tous les domaines, il vous embarquera dans des aventures professionnelles et culinaires dignes de Into the Wild, son film préféré.

description:
Société : IQVIAJob Description

Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Health Information Analyst, Healthcare Oncology

IQVIA Real World & Analytics Solutions (RWAS)

Paris, with travel

IQVIA is leading the development of a new business service, a pan-European infrastructure which collects and aggregates routine oncology healthcare data within hospital trusts to deliver real world evidence analytical reports on healthcare and pharmaceutical product use at a patient level. IQVIA is working with healthcare providers on this new RWAS initiative which will analyze patient-level data sources across multiple healthcare providers in several European countries.

Role Description

This role will offer you a unique opportunity to work on a novel, large, clinically rich oncology data set working as a key member of a small, dedicated team within a hospital trust. This opportunity arises as a consequence of a partnership between IQVIA and the healthcare data owners: the context for your work will be the cross-over between the IQVIA RWAS team, the hospital trust and the applications of RWD for life sciences clients.

Concretely, this role has 2 distinct components:
Ability to prepare and analyse pseudonymised patient-level data, according to agreed protocols and statistical analysis plans. The audience for these analyses will be varied, including clinical teams, service managers, academics and life-sciences customers.

An in-depth understanding the oncology research repository data-model, the transformations that have been applied to the data, the source systems the data comes from and good relationships with the source system owners. This understanding will be used to inform the on-going development of the research repository and the proactive identification of data irregularities

The successful candidate will have excellent programming skills (e.g. SQL, R, Stata, Python & SAS) and use them to deliver clinical analytics to deadlines that could be either clinician-led or industry-led.

The purpose of this role is to facilitate the study of a broad set of interesting analytical and statistical questions that are directly related to care delivery and patient outcomes. Given the clinical services setting, this role will provide exposure to additional aspects of data set management and enhancements, including both exploratory approaches to insight generation and the design and development of management reports and dashboards.

Principal Accountabilities

As Clinical Informatician, Healthcare Oncology, you will have the opportunity to contribute to all stages of real-world evidence studies, including:

Study design: Helping to choose appropriate approaches, data management, analytical and statistical design to meet study objectives. This may in the longer term also include interventional studies and direct collection of patient reported dataDevelop approaches to analyse a novel datasetContribute to writing of study proposals, including statistical analysis sectionsWrite SAPs, specify for table shells and figures as required
Inform the mapping and transformation of source system data fields to the Research repositoryDevelop good relationships with system owners and the onsite clinical coderIdentify key data sources in target systems and necessary transformations to instruct the Data Integration Engineer
Data preparation and analysisExtract data from the research repository (SQL), write SAS/R/Stata/Python code to prepare analysis of datasets according to study protocol or SAP
Project documentation and proceduresDocument processes for data extraction, organisation and storageDevelop procedures for efficient data extraction and re-use of codeDevelop data dictionaries etc. as required
ReportingProvide assistance in the write up and presentation of the results appropriate for the intended audience
Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Candidates interested in joining the IQVIA RWAS as a Clinical Informatician, Healthcare Oncology will have:

Essential:
Prior experience and comfort with working with large-scale data relating to healthcare
Strong MS SQL programming experience
Strong SAS/R/Stata/Python programming skills
Ability to independently undertake data quality check and prepare cohorts using real-world databases
Experience of creating tables and figures
Fluency in English and French (spoken and written)
A commitment to work collaboratively & effectively with others in and across teams with different expertise
Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks under tight timelines
Desirable Skills:
Familiarity with working with large real-world cancer healthcare data
MSc (or equivalent) in Medical Statistics, Bio-informatics or a related field
Experience working with prospective and/or retrospective oncology studies, including database analyses
Experience working in close collaboration with clinicians
Experience and knowledge of current issues in the pharmaceutical industry
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people . Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and

Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!

We invite you to join IQVIA™.

We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes. Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there! We invite you to join IQVIA™

Job Description

The Director, Global Revenue Growth Management will lead the Revenue Growth Management function with accountability for development and implementation of the overall RGM strategy via omni-channel guidelines for Pricing, Promotions, Trade spend and Assortment and tools and processes for in-market optimization. Proactively and collaboratively work across the Company to determine the strategies that can effectively be used as a lever to grow revenue and improve profit for the organization.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop RGM strategy and ensure organizational alignment and buy-in
Define omni-channel guidelines across RGM levers for Pricing, Promotions, Trade spend and Assortment; in particular:
Run standard pricing analytics (e.g., pricing potential by pack, price pack curve, brand ladder vs. competition),
Share guidelines on promo calendar (optimal discount depth / lift by pack),
Establish high-level trade architecture and terms guidance
Set up tools, processes and trainings for in-market optimization, including cascading of KPIs (for RGM vs. local teams), hosting of “RGM Summits” every quarter and upskilling of local teams (via dedicated trainings and starting with sales analysts)
Interface with 3rd party data and research vendors in order to provide analytical inputs on category and regional opportunities
Align between functions involved in RGM (especially Marketing, Sales, Advanced Analytics, Finance) and coordinate programs and actions needed to implement recommendations
Coach and develop a team of 4 Revenue Growth manager
Build of RGM expertise across organization, including driving to common understanding and “language” around RGM
Provide ad hoc support in RGM for local teams & other functions (e.g., how to leverage RGM to support growth aspirations for a brand in a given channel) to help them meet and exceed their budgeted revenue targets and continually improve their profitability margins
Consolidate ROI at global level to be shared with ExCom

Qualifications

Successful Candidates will possess:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business or a related analytical field.
10 + years of business experience in analytical role within FMCG managing multi-site operations.
At least 5 years of prior revenue management experience required. Previous role in sales / commercial finance highly preferred.
Ability to work collaboratively within a large multi-site operations organization
Proven success developing Pricing & Promotion structures
Strong financial analysis skills a must
Highly proficient using financial analysis tools such as Excel, JDEdwards, BI, etc... Knowledge of IRI, Nielsen systems a plus
Results-oriented leader with proven track record for delivering sustainable results
Strong change management capabilities
Fluent business English

Apply Today! There's never been a better time to join BIC. We're a dynamic company with a strong vision. You will find a wealth of possibilities in a challenging and rewarding work environment. As an organization, we have a passion for taking care of our people, and our benefits reflect this. Join BIC and let’s invent our future, together!

description:
Société : ENGIEWHO WE ARE

ENGIE is a global energy company, a leading provider of electricity, natural gas, and energy services. With 153,090 employees in more than 70 countries worldwide, ENGIE achieved revenue of €66.6 billion in 2016. ENGIE is committed to being a leader in the energy transition.

We are looking for talented and motivated people to create the future of energy. Join a rewarding and flexible work environment that encourages innovation and creativity, and help us meet the energy challenges of today and tomorrow.

Global Energy Management (GEM) is one of ENGIE’s Business Units. We deliver services in supply and logistics management, asset management, risk management, market access management, while contributing to the market understanding, design and efficiency and developing market solutions to accelerate the energy transition.

GEM manages one of the largest and most diversified energy portfolios in Europe, including electricity, natural gas, bulk commodities and environmental products.

With 5 trading platforms and activities in more than 50 countries, GEM has an extended geographical coverage in Europe, Asia-Pacific and in the US. It employs 1,300 people around the world.

Within the market risk department, the Global risk Analysis team identifies, monitors, advises, challenges and controls the market risks generated by GEM activities.

The role involves working with desks-facing risk managers, risk methodo and IT teams to drive developments. The dynamic nature of the role involves improving existing as well as building new processes and capabilities associated with VaR and provide exposures.

In this context, he/she is responsible for: -

Producing and monitoring of market risk indicators (VaR, Stress tests, Risk exposures versus limits) and Communicating drivers of risk exposure and limit utilizations to FO, Risk and Finance stakeholders
Reporting and running risk analysis, investigating large variances impacting risk sensitivities, VaR and Stress Tests.
Designing, developing and maintaining tools for reporting and analysis
Coordinating and preparing analyses of risk limits increases when necessary
Participating with the other teams (risk, support or FO) in analyses to develop or launch activities
Fostering close links and cooperation with the Front Office teams, the Department’s other teams (Local market risk officers ,SBA, Trading Surveillance, OTR, etc.), the DCFTA team (Group risk monitoring).
The Market Risk Analyst may be called upon to work on cross-cutting issues and cases within the Risk Department and within GEM.

PROFILE
Master in Finance or Quantitative field preferred
3 + years industry experience with IT, markets or risk focus
A good understanding of risk management tools such as Value-at-Risk, Stressed-Value-at-Risk and Greek measures for the risk representation
Strong analytical skills, problem -solving mindset
Ability to communicate complex issues to stakeholders, both written and verbally, in a clear concise manner
Proactivewith ability to work as both part of a close-knit team and independently
Strong IT skills are required to facilitate data analysis. Programming skills (VBA, R, Python) as well as working knowledge of databases is advantageous.
English & French a must
Post is based in Paris, La Défense

Protéger les clients
Prévenir le risque d'image

description:
Who are we?

PayFit simplifies payroll management and HR processes for SMBs. We have built a fast, intuitive and automated SaaS solution to help business owners and HR professionals save time and money allowing them to refocus and what really matters: their employees. Through PayFit, employees have a dedicated access for their payslips and are able to manage efficiently their leave and expense requests.

To build such a solution, we have created our own programming language: JetLang. Thanks to JetLang we were able to code Labour Code and collective agreements, and today we continue to add new features.

We have set ourselves a mission to support the digital transformation of HR management through our ever growing range of product features and services. We have a strong presence in France since 2015 and have been quickly growing in Germany, Spain and the UK.

More than 3000 companies such as Big Mamma, MinuteBuzz or Sellsy to name a few already trust us. Over 300 PayFiters have already joined the adventure and we have raised 95M€ to keep growing.

Your role Be the first Data Analyst of PayFit!

Your missions

Within the Data team, you will be positioned as the first Data Analyst to contribute to the general PayFit growth. You'll be in charge of:

working closely with our product and business teams to identify important questions, define key success metrics
shaping data-informed product/business strategies
working closely with the lead data engineer and the lead data analyst to develop and own our data pipelines, infrastructure & roadmap
developing compelling dashboards to measure the impact of new product features or business initiatives
proactively analyzing internal and external data to suggest improvements to our product and business development teams
communicating results and influence key product and business leaders

This job has been tailored for you if...

you have experience in an analytical role
you have a strong logic & business sense
you are autonomous, self-starter, detail-oriented
you are proactive, and have a problem-solving mindset
you have strong communication skills
you have strong analytical & data driven skills (A/B tests, statistics…)

Must have :
Experience with a data visualization tool (Tableau, Looker, Periscope, Chart.io, etc.)
Familiarity with a scripting language (Python, R, VBA, Matlab,...)
Academic background or experience in statistics, econometry, probability, applied mathematics

We are meant to work together if...

you are a real team player who wants to build a big success story with us,
you speak both french and english fluently and you want to work in an international and dynamic environment,
you have strong interpersonal and communication skills,
you want to learn, improve and gain responsibility.

What we offer ❤️

an amazing working environment, designed for kindness and blossoming,
an attractive remuneration package,
an international and dynamic team with the opportunity to visit our different offices (Paris, Berlin, Barcelona, London),
remote friendly policy,
a gym inside the office and Gymlib subscription with preferential rate,
regular team and global events,
restaurant tickets,
4 weeks of paternity leave (fully covered) and 20 weeks of maternity leave (fully covered),
Alan insurance (60% covered by PayFit),
great coffee, fruits, snacks, foosball, MPG Teams or even team yoga classes,
MacBooks are our standard, but we'll provide whatever equipment you need to help you get your job done!
Want to know more about our epic team?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0uqNUw2JIk

We are looking for passionate and innovative people who want to build the next big success story with us! Do you recognize yourself in these words? Do you want to join an incredible adventure?

Tell us who you are, what you’ve done and what you're looking to achieve. We’ll be more than happy to meet you :)

Mission
Monoprix avance dans la création d'une culture davantage data-driven, dans un contexte de renforcement de la pression concurrentielle et d'accélération de la transformation de l'entreprise.

Rôle de l'équipe
Vous rejoignez l'équipe « analyse commerciale », en cours de constitution (super sympa, dynamique et pleine d'ambition), dont la vocation est d'accélérer l'accès aux insights analytiques et les mettre au cœur des processus de décision de l'entreprise. L'ambition est la suivante :
Devenir la « GO-TO » team pour la résolution de problèmes business complexes et transversaux à la demande de la Direction Générale ou des métiers, en capacité de mobiliser un large spectre de sources de données quantitatives (données de vente, supply chain, client, géographiques, catégorielles, météo, concurrence, etc…)
Accompagner les métiers à la création d'outils intégrant directement une donnée qualifiée et décisive au cœur de leur processus de travail, qui supposent de travailler main dans la main avec les clients internes pour mapper leurs workflows et normer les méthodes de travail
Initier et piloter des projets de transformation à fort impact business, basés sur des insights analytiques solides
Votre rôle :
1. Assurer la fiabilité et l'exploitabilité de certains périmètres de données (particulièrement donnée marché)

2. Favoriser l'exploitation d'une donnée transverse :
a. Mettre en place des liens pour croiser davantage les données et leurs sources (« tout sous le même toit »)
b. Mise en perspective des indicateurs internes de l'entreprise avec les données externes

3. Développer une culture analytique et chiffrée au sein de l'entreprise :
a. Proposer des suivis/analyses simples avec visualisation ergonomique pour faciliter des diagnostics de performance autonomes de la part des opérationnels
b. Faire preuve de pédagogie pour former les opérationnels aux données mises à leur disposition
c. Mettre à disposition des modèles prédictifs pour aider à la prise de décision
d. Accompagner une culture du « Post-mortem » systématique après des tests/pilotes

4. Accompagner les opérationnels sur leurs problématiques à moyen-termes :
a. Identifier des potentiels de croissance interne

Profil souhaité
Formation supérieure (Bac +5), Ecole de Commerce / d'Ingénieur

emploi

Votre future équipe
La croissance de la demande de connectivité on-board, le développement des nouvelles mobilités, la perspective des véhicules autonomes et la nécessité de la maitrise de nos données ont abouti à la création en juillet 2018, au sein de l’ingénierie de la direction après-vente, d’un nouveau service en charge de la synthèse de ce périmètre.
Le contexte
En interface avec les métiers de la DEA, le service Nouvelle Mobilité et Services Connectés a en charge de définir les politiques de diagnostic, d’assistance, de management des datas e-DAV et de coordonner les actions de la DAV face aux problématiques posées par les nouveaux modes de mobilités.
La direction de l'après vente est en charge des prestations permettant à l'entreprise de fournir l'ensemble des prestations permettant aux réseaux monde d'assurer le bon niveau de qualité de services.
Au sein de cette entité l'ingénierie après vente tournée vers les réseaux et les clients commercialise les outils documentaires et de diagnostiic, définie les méthodes réparations et de diagnostic.
En tant que Data gathering pilot - Pilote remontée data, vous serez rattaché au Chef UET Services Solutions Engineering
Le poste est basé sur notre site du Technocentre à Guyancourt (78)

Le poste est à pourvoir en CDI. Statut Cadre.

Vos missions et responsabilités
Vous serez garant de la politique technique de l'Ingénierie Après Vente (eDAV) pour l'acquisition des données sur les véhicules de la gamme du groupe et de leur transfert vers les systèmes débarqués. Vous devrez dans ce cadre :
Recenser les besoins datas des leaders services eux mêmes issus des prestations exigés par les Business leader.
Définir avec les métiers e-Dav et ingénierie les moyens techniques assurant la collecte de ces datas sir les véhicules et leur stockage en vue d'exploitation technique et/ou commerciale


Vous contribuez avec les métiers et le data manager, à la politique technique de l’e-Dav lié à l'acquisition et la livraison des données liées aux services (Maintenance prédictive, diagnostique à distance, , assistance, réparabilité …)

Vous garantissez la qualité et de la traçabilité des données échangées par les systèmes embarqués et débarqués et leur mise à disposition en vue d’une exploitation technique et business.

Vous serez en interaction avec les autres membres du service (chef de projet apres-vente, expert cybersécurité), mais votre activité sera par essence orientée vers les products owner service.
Ingénierie Systèmes et Connectivités : DEA-S/C-ACV, Car Data Lab
RSI : Entité Business Services : RSI
Fournisseurs de systèmes de connectivité

L'objectif de l'après vente est de mettre en avant de nouvelles sources de Business.
La connectivité des véhicules est une opportunité présentant des perspectives prométeuses même si elles ne sont pas encore toutes identifiées.
Pour répondre aux défis technologiques, sociétaux et environnementaux que nous voulons solutionner, nous avons besoin de l’engagement de l’ensemble des femmes et des hommes du Groupe.
Pour garantir cet engagement et être toujours plus mobile, connecté et autonome, vous participerez à notre dispositif d’accueil afin de découvrir votre environnement de travail et les autres nouveaux embauchés. Vous réaliserez des stages en usine, et au commerce, de plusieurs jours pour mieux connaître le Groupe et ses enjeux. Vous bénéficierez de formations tout au long de votre parcours professionnel pour piloter de nouveaux projets, changer de métier, continuer à apprendre.

Ingénieur 3EA
débutant ou second poste.
Electronique
Connaissance des architectures SI/IT
Programmation
Autonomie
Curiosité
Synthèse
Animation transversale

- PO services
DEA C
Diagnostic Off Board

Votre environnement de travail et les avantages que nous vous apportons

Situé à 30 kilomètres de Paris, le Technocentre rassemble, sur un site unique, toutes les compétences et technologies inhérentes à la conception de nos véhicules.
Le design et les avant projets sont réalisés à l'Avancée. Les prototypes des futures voitures sont faits au Proto. Les projets véhicules sont pilotés à la Ruche.
La notoriété de ce site n'est pas anodine. Chaque détail a été pensé. Le Technocentre, également nommé le Losange depuis 2010, a été conçu par 11 architectes français qui ont chacun apporté leur patte artistique afin de mettre l'architecture au cœur de la Qualité de vie.
Plus de 12 000 collaborateurs et collaboratrices disposent de multiples services : restaurants, salles de conférence, banque, salon de coiffure, pressing, cordonnerie, mutuelle, boutiques, école de formation, crèches, etc. Les rues, espaces verts et rivières ont des allures de villes modernes.

Nos autres avantages :
Vous évoluerez au sein d'un secteur en pleine transformation : voitures connectées, véhicules autonomes, nouvelles solutions de mobilité.
Vous travaillerez pour un grand Groupe international qui propose de fortes perspectives d'évolution à ses collaborateurs et collaboratrices.
Vous apprendrez au quotidien et monterez en compétences grâce à nos équipes pluridisciplinaires et l'éventail des technologies existant dans nos véhicules.
Vous profiterez des réductions sur les gammes Renault, Dacia, Nissan, d'un CE d'exception et de nos belles infrastructures.
Vous bénéficierez de la diversité culturelle du Groupe toujours plus mobile, connecté et autonome.

date_publication:

description:
QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?
Sur plus de 30 sites en France, les 1 400 collaborateurs des services partagés du Groupe œuvrent chaque jour pour délivrer en interne des Services, accélérateurs de performance. En mutualisant tout ou partie des grandes fonctions de l’entreprise au sein de centres d’expertises, Thales améliore ainsi sa compétitivité, favorise sa croissance et développe ses talents en faisant des services partagés, une étape clé dans un parcours de carrière.
Le site de Vélizy regroupe les activités des services partagés du groupe, le Learning Hub (centre de formation du Groupe) ainsi que le Géris (société de développement économique local de Thales, www.geris.fr).
L’équipe DSI Groupe, recherche un/une GROUP DATA ARCHITECT (H/F)
Poste basé à Vélizy
QUI ETES-VOUS ?
Vous êtes issu(e) d’une formation Bac +5 université ou école d'ingénieurs ?
Vous avez une expérience professionnelle confirmée avec des Data Managers, et/ou Data Owners et/ou Chief Data Officer ?
Vous possédez une méthodologie d’analyse dirigée par les données ?
Vous savez réaliser des travaux d’architecture ?
Votre expérience en analyse de valeur métier est un plus ?
Vous aimez travailler en équipe ?
Vous avez un bon état d’esprit, le sens de l’initiative et êtes force de proposition ?
Vous possédez un anglais courant avec de bonnes capacités rédactionnelles pour synthétiser ?
CE QUE NOUS POUVONS ACCOMPLIR ENSEMBLE :
Contexte :
Dans le cadre de sa transformation digitale, Thales doit exploiter la donnée interne, avec la gouvernance adéquate, et ce en tant que base d’amélioration et de croissance de l’entreprise.
Elle repose sur une organisation de la donnée appropriée, avec une propriété claire de la donnée, et une carte explicitant comment sont reliés les différents éléments de données. Il est ainsi crucial pour Thales de recruter un Architecte Data pour rejoindre ses équipes.
L’Architecte Data rapportera conjointement au Chief Data Officer et au Chief Enterprise Architect, tout en étant rattaché hiérarchiquement à la DSI Groupe. Il/elle se focalisera sur l’organisation des données internes, permettant l’exploitation à la fois des données internes et externes. En interagissant étroitement avec les organes de Data Governance et Data Analysis, il/elle jouera un rôle crucial pour exploiter les données Thales.
Son/sa mission consistera en deux activités principales:
Maintenir un modèle de données global, garantissant la cohérence de la donnée avec les data owners identifiés
Supporter le Group Data Manager pour construire le modèle haut niveau des objets métiers de Thales: hiérarchie des données, applications de référence et préparation de la validation par les parties prenantes clés
Formaliser le modèle de données et le modèle d’objets métier, en se concentrant sur leur corrélation
Définir comment les données devraient être organisées au sein du Datalake commun en complément des ilôts de données locaux (données réglementaires pays), et aligné avec le modèle haut niveau
Supporter les cas d’usage d’analyse de données
Définir les lignes directes d’architecture en s’appuyant sur les fonctionnalités core data (capacité de stockage de données, gestion des accès, etc.)
Ajuster le modèle de données global en s’appuyant sur ces cas d’usage
Les réalisations de l’Architecte Data Architect se baseront sur les éléments fournis par les Fonctions Thales (Finance, Ingénierie, Industrie, …), des métiers (Global Business Units) et de l’Architecture d’Entreprise.
L’Architecte Data interagira avec le Group Chief Data Officer et son organisation (GBU Data Officers et les Data Managers), pour permettre une gouvernance efficace, pour garantir la qualité des données, aussi bien à un niveau local qu’à un niveau groupe.
Il/elle intéragira aussi avec les interlocuteurs IS/IT pour assurer la cohérence du modèle de données avec les applications et avec les Data analysts pour assurer l’applicabilité du modèle.
Innovation, passion, ambition : rejoignez Thales et créez le monde de demain, dès aujourd’hui.

description:
Senior Credit Analyst - Non Financial - Paris (190009N0)
PRIMARY LOCATION : FRANCE-75-PARIS-PARIS
ORGANIZATION : GIE AXA
CONTRACT TYPE : Regular
SHIFT : Day Job
SCHEDULE : Full-time
DESCRIPTION
As part of the Group Credit Team, the mission of the Credit Analyst is :
To cover a set of issuers relevant to AXA Group’s credit investment portfolio or to AXA Group’s credit-sensitive insurance activities
To Make recommendations on the Internal Credit Ratings and the eligibility status of these issuers. An eligible status will allow the Group to invest more in a certain name. And the Internal Credit Rating is the main driver for the Group Risk Management’s Limit and Internal Capital (STEC) Frameworks.

As a senior Credit Analyst you will have the responsibility to cover a number of non-financial institutions, and so needs to:

Perform a fundamental analysis of his/her covered names ;
Contribute to the team’s efforts to integrate ESG in credit, in particular for the industry he/she will be covering;
Monitor the performance of the credit profile for his/her covered names, in relation with the situation on financial markets;

Your main missions will be:

Write in-depth credit assessment with proposals for Internal Credit Ratings and eligibility status for the names covered (part of the Credit Universe or outside)
Produce sector reviews when all issuers under coverage have been individually assessed
Propose ESG KPIs that are credit-relevant for the industries under coverage
Produce timely surveillance notes on key credit events and their impact on ICRs and/or eligibility status and Sell/Hold recommendation
Update watch name Sell/Hold recommendations and support the action plan process as needed
Review relative value and risk adjusted returns of the names covered together with the Credit Strategist
Any other ad-hoc team project, eg development of alert tool, and other data analysis initiatives as discussed with the Manager and agreed in the objectives
Build strong relationships both internally (with the Credit Strategist, etc), and outside the team (local entities, asset managers, GRM etc) as well as outside the Group (with rating agencies, issuers, brokers etc

QUALIFICATIONS
The targeted background for the Credit Analyst includes:
Master’s degree in Finance or Business
At least 2-3 years of experience in credit analysis out of at least 3-5 years of relevant work experience in a financial institution
Fluency in written and spoken English
Familiarity with credit-sensitive insurance businesses or trade finance a plus
CFA or equivalent desirable

The Credit Analyst needs to have strong Credit Analysis skills and good knowledge of financial markets. Exposure to ESG integration in credit or ESG analysis would be a plus.

His/her analytical skills and financial knowledge enables him to perform the fundamental analysis of his/her covered names understand the pros & cons of this asset class for the construction of the portfolio.

The Credit Analyst needs to understand the stakes and objectives of the Group.
He/She needs to be able to work autonomously in a rigorous fashion to perform his/her fundamental reviews and communicating his/her recommendations.


He/She needs to have good listening skills and verbal skill to communicate clearly his/her analytical convictions.

He/She needs to seek dialogue with his/her peers in order to understand and take into account the different aspects of the various issues which can often be very complex.

He/She needs to be well organised and to know how to deliver under tight deadlines.
ABOUT AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers.

The headquarters of the AXA Group, based in Paris 8th, brings together the Group's corporate activities. It coordinates the various entities with the Group's strategy, and is responsible for managing international projects. The headquarters has approximately 800 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (39 nationalities).

WHAT WE OFFER
We provide you regular career opportunities in international teams. If you want to join us, don’t hesitate to apply !

Information provided by applicants will be processed in strict confidentiality and may be used exclusively for recruitment processes.

description:
IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.
IQVIA has approximately 55,000 employees in more than 100 countries, all committed to making the potential of Human Data Science a reality, and we are actively hiring.
Reimagine healthcare with us
At IQVIA, you will have the opportunity to build your career, while helping our customers drive human health outcomes forward. We dedicate our experience, resources and reputation so that you can drive your career and choose the path that best defines your development and success.
The Technology Solutions division of IQVIA develops, markets, and implements healthcare-focused enterprise software applications to help life sciences customers drive their business from molecule to market.
Function Purpose
Technology Solutions' Global Delivery organization contributes to the implementation and ongoing support of the IQVIA technology product portfolio at Life Sciences clients around the world. The scope of Global Delivery includes:
Serving the needs of IQVIA Regional Business Units to deliver IQVIA Tech Solutions product offerings either in full, or in coordination with their regional Delivery teams
End-to-end delivery coverage for the full SDLC (implementation through support)
Leadership of complex multi-country or integrated solutions, particularly in Europe (Program/Project Mgmt, Business Analysis, Solution Architecture)
Supplying skilled technical resources from low-cost delivery centers in Europe and South Asia (Dev/Config, Testing, Service Desk, Tier 2 Support)
Role Overview
The Information Management (IM) Integrated Business Analyst position ensures successful product delivery by designing and delivering, in close relationship with architects and technical developers, end-to-end Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Warehousing solutions for IQVIA Clients.
Responsibilities
As Information Management Integrated Business Analyst, you will:
Be accountable for the overall writing of business requirements, analysis of Client data as key inputs to the design of technical MDM and CDW solutions
As an integrated business analyst, you will ensure this analysis is done with an end-to-end business process perspective in mind – most of the time this will consists in analysis data across Data sources (One Key among others) – MDM – CRM
Ensure that business and functional conditions are in place for a successful delivery of the MDM / CDW solution; more specifically, you will assess Client readiness from a business perspective; if needed, you will provide recommendations and plans to address “non readiness” issues
Work hand-in-hand with delivery managers to ensure escalations (from Clients or internal from RBU/Country stakeholders) are addressed adequately; the Integrated Business analyst to address business and data issues and propose adequate solution in coordination with the technical lead, and architect in the projects
Engage with customers on regular basis (project kick-off, project meetings, workshops with business stakeholders)
Within a project, functionally manage / advise the technical delivery team (onshore, nearshore and/or offshore) as per needs
As Integrated Business analyst, work closely with additional teams contributing to the delivery of Information Management solutions, including PMO, offshore technical delivery centers and service management.
Work closely with the IM product team, to get full knowledge and understand the IM products (MDM and CDW); provide feedback to the product roadmap, anticipate impact on the assigned IM projects.
Work closely with RBU IM leaders to understand IM forecast and regional specifics
Participate in the business development process for IM opportunities as needed
Coordinate with the One Key team and maintain a close business relationship
Coordinate and establish a relationship with other delivery teams (OCE, Compliance, PMI) as per IM project needs
Skills & Experience
8+ years' experience managing Information Management project implementation
Strong MDM and Data Management functional and business skills
Ability to work with project teams geographically dispersed
Deep knowledge of SaaS business model and end-to-end delivery model, with specific expertise in IM Implementation in a complex systems landscape
Robust experience designing and delivering complex IT solutions
Expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Warehousing including experience and knowledge in the following technologies: Reltio (MDM, CDW) and Informatica (ETL)
Additional qualifications: used to deliver with an agile approach, as well as with other iterative / hybrid approaches
Demonstrated success building effective relationships with a broad spectrum of internal and external stakeholders, including senior business leaders and associates across different functions
Thrives in a fast-paced environment and able to match stakeholder expectations to urgently deliver exceptional results
Excellent communications, problem solving, functional and technical skills
Knowledge of Healthcare/Life Sciences Industry
Experience in global roles; understanding of cultural sensitivities and time zones required.
Flexible, periodic travel for internal and client meetings
Join Us
Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.
Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

description:
À propos
A propos de Nickel
Lancée il y a moins de 5 ans comme une alternative aux banques traditionnelles, Nickel est une offre de compte courant sans découvert, qui s’ouvre en 5 minutes dans un bureau de tabac pour 20€ / an. Ouvert à tous, sans condition de revenus ni de patrimoine, Nickel a déjà permis à plus d'1 million de personnes de vivre la banque autrement de façon utile, simple et bienveillante, signe d’un véritable phénomène de société. Premier ouvreur de comptes en France, Nickel est une fintech de 340 personnes qui grandit et se structure, dans des bureaux à Paris et à Nantes.
Servir près d’un million quatre cent mille clients au quotidien représente un formidable challenge, notamment lorsqu’il s’agit d’apporter conseil, accompagnement et informations utiles tout au long de la vie de leur compte. Dans le cadre de notre forte croissance, nous recherchons des nouveaux talents.
Descriptif du poste
Vos missions
En tant que “Data Engineer & OPS” dans l’équipe “Data Science et Analytics” (composée de trois data scientists et un data analyst) vous serez amené(e) à :
Mettre en place la collecte et processing des données en temps réel (ETL)depuis les différentes sources pour les stocker dans BigQuery (actuellement, batchs quotidiens) ;
Garantir l’intégrité des données ainsi que leur documentation ;
Etre force de proposition sur l’architecture et les technologies ;
Mettre en place des bonnes pratiques devops :
CI/CD, git workflow, revues de code, architecture scalable, infra as code, monitoring (infra, tests auto, applicatifs) afin de garantir l’agilité et la fiabilité des algorithmes de machine learning mis en production.
Participer au développement d'applications data, par exemples :
profiling temps réel de clients pour lutte anti-fraude et anti-blanchiment d’argent ;
ciblage des prochains points de vente à prospecter ;
analyse des commentaires des clients sur les réseaux sociaux ;
analyse et prédiction du churn ;
optimisations pour le call center.
Vous aurez à coeur de comprendre les enjeux business et de communiquer avec l’IT afin de concevoir les meilleures solutions tout en diffusant les bonnes pratiques du cloud dans l’équipe.
Profil recherché
Vous êtes diplômé(e)s d'un bac+3/5 ou équivalent et avez au minimum 5 ans d’expérience mais surtout maitrisez les technos détaillées ci-après.
Technos
Google Cloud Platform : BigQuery, Kafka, PubSub, Dataflow, AppEngine, Cloud Function
Sources de données : Kafka, Cassandra, SQL Server, MongoDB, services SAAS
Langages : SQL, python (scikit-learn, xgboost, pandas), éventuellement java.
Informations complémentaires
Type de contrat : CDI
Date de début : 01 septembre 2019
Lieu : Charenton-Le-Pont, France (94220)
Niveau d'études : Bac +3
Expérience : > 5 ans

Grâce à notre offre et à la force commerciale du groupe Solocal, des artisans ou commerçants peuvent désormais apparaître, mettre en avant leurs produits/services et trouver leurs futurs lients sur les moteurs de recherches.
Le challenge du projet : allier scalabilité et qualité !
Garants de la quantité et de la qualité des contacts que nous livrons à nos clients, nous travaillons quotidiennement pour automatiser et optimiser nos outils et process dans le but de pouvoir gérer et satisfaire des dizaines de milliers de clients.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.
What you will be doing: Key responsibilities
Your role will be encompass:
Build and lead our Consulting Department in country (P&L responsibility). The leadership structure for this Department is a partnership, similar to those found in Management Consulting firms.
Bring the best of our expertise from the other Departments to your clients on Data Science, Activation (e.g., media buying, CRM, …) and Creativity.
Impact-driven with real sales abilities, you will have to embark our clients top executives (CMOs, CDO, sometime directly the CEOs) into a transformation of their marketing department and make sure Artefact/NetBooster is their preferred partner in this endeavour.
Among your responsibilities as Partner, you will :
Develop the country Consulting Department
Pilot the consulting department P&L (forecast, revenue and margin, cash, reporting to country and global management) in link with the Finance department in country
Define the HR needed and the process to attract and retain the best talents from the consulting and the digital space
Ensure the best allocation of consultants resources to clients and projects (staffing)
Develop the consultants expertises through trainings and best practice sharing with the other countries (digital ecosystem, consulting hard skills, soft skills, …)
Communicate the Department successes and results at country level (ex : through events and PR)
Deliver the highest standards of quality on your projects
Pilot multidisciplinary teams (consultants, data scientists, strategic planners, media traders)
Ensure the highest level of quality of output to your clients
Accountable for the success of the projects from a client and team perspective
Develop client portfolio (hunting)
Build a commercial strategy to develop the country client portfolio (consulting is a very good step in the door) through personal contacts, events, cold calls, …
Monitor the commercial pipeline
Build proposals supporting the client needs
Strengthen our relationships with current clients (farming)
Develop the consulting offer with existing clients, especially with Activation or Data clients
Create opportunities for other Departments with your clients (Data Science, Activation, Creativity)
Develop our Global Knowledge platform
Build stronghold of knowledge through your clients engagements (frameworks, methodologies, technologies, …)
Ensure the spread of the Consulting Department knowledge across the company at local and Global level (in coordination with the Consulting Practice)
What we are looking for
You have demonstrated success in your first 10+ years of career at a tier 1 consulting firm and have 6+ years of experience managing projects and/or clients.
DOER : you get things done yourself and inspire your teams to do so
ANALYTIC : you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions with facts
HUNTER : you identify business opportunities and enjoy
MOVER AND SHAKER : you have a hacker mindset and always find the quick wins
MENTOR : your clients and teams naturally seek for advice
AUTONOMOUS : you’re an entrepreneur…
Why you should join us
Artefact is the place to be: come and build the future of marketing
Progress: every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
Culture: join the best team you could ever imagine
Entrepreneurship: you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!
#FR

Based in Paris (Issy Les Moulineaux), the Senior Solutions Consultant works with the Sales Account Executive on developing identified business opportunities. The Senior Solutions Consultant works in a consultative role to understand customer needs (functional & technical) and maps them to Genesys software, services, and consulting offerings. He or she works with all levels of customer organizations tailoring the messaging to meet the needs of various business and technical stakeholders including C-level decision makers. This role is imperative to the success of sales opportunities.

Key Responsibilities:

A Senior Solutions Consultant is responsible for engaging in business-focused solution discoveries with customers to understand their operation, customer experience and demonstrate the value that can be created through the implementation of Genesys solutions.

Customer Facing Responsibilities:

Discover
Run successful workshops with business users to uncover gaps and opportunities in the current way a company interacts with their customers.
Consult on Customer Engagement, Employee Engagement, Business Optimization best practices and optimization
Define the projected benefits for the identified experience & engagement gaps
Document and present the outcomes of discovery to business audience
Design
Run successful co-creation workshops with business and technical users to define a new target for optimized engagements
Create prototypes or customized demos to define the scope of new solution
Design economic viable solutions with high level Business and Solutions Architecture
Document and present the design outcomes to both business & technical audience
Propose
Present solutions options framework with road map to achieve target state
Be a compelling speaker that communicate the value of solutions
Tailor demonstrations to prove how business objectives are met
Deliver solution & product related responses on RFI’s/RFP’s

Other Responsibilities:

Learn
Stay up to date on Genesys solutions and industry knowledge
Gain insights how customers use Genesys & other industry solutions to build systems for Customer Engagement, Employee Engagement, Business Optimization
Stay in touch with the Customer and Genesys Services team during the implementation to validate how benefits are being realized with the business and solution Architecture
Contribute in knowledge sharing initiatives both internal and partner community
Support corporate initiatives with field input for the commercialization of new solutions

5+ years previous as a presales consultant role with experience in Consultative sales for high value business solution
Strong written and verbal communication skills with a focus on needs analysis, positioning, business justification, and closing techniques
Strong Experience in use cases live demonstrations and presentations
Strong time-management and organization skills
Ability to multi-task and manage multiple streams of work simultaneously
Ability to work and communicate effectively with internal stakeholders
Ability to solve complex technical and selling situations with proposed resolutions
Ability to work effectively, independently and with team members to add value
Ability to display strong self-initiative and support recommendations with fact-based evidence (data, research, best practices, etc.)
Be self-motivated, flexible, and show initiative
Proven record of meeting/exceeding established goals
Fluent or native French and high level English both spoken and written

Preferred
International sale or business consulting experience is a plus
Enterprise software or contact centre industry experience is a plus
Previous experience and knowledge on Genesys portfolio is highly valued (preferably PureConnect)
Experience with Cloud or SaaS based software sales

About Us:
Genesys® powers more than 25 billion of the world’s best customer experiences each year. We put the customer at the center of everything we do and passionately believe that great customer engagement drives great business outcomes. More than 10,000 companies in more than 100 countries trust the industry’s #1 customer experience platform to orchestrate omnichannel customer journeys that eliminate silos and build lasting relationships. With a strong track record of innovation and a never-ending desire to be first, Genesys is the only company recognized by top industry analysts as a leader in both cloud and on-premise customer engagement solutions. Connect with Genesys via www.genesys.com, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and the Genesys blog.

Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

description:
Au sein du middle office de la Direction des Investissements des ACM, vous serez en charge de gérer l’interface utilisateurs relative à la base de donnés interne et d’assister les équipes de gestion d’actifs (Front Office) dans l’automatisation de nombreuses tâches liées aux opérations de marché et aux activités de reporting financier.
Activités et tâches spécifiques
A ce titre, en étroite collaboration avec des équipes en charge de la base de données interne (infocentre), vous établirez des tableaux de bord sur les portefeuilles. Les principales missions sont :
Développer des requêtes utilisateurs sous Business Objects (BO), afin d’extraire des données de l’infocentre.
Produire, à l’aide de ces requêtes, des tableaux de bord (Dataviz) à destination des gérants de portefeuilles.
S’assurer de la qualité des données de l’infocentre et remonter d’éventuelles anomalies aux équipes en charge d’alimenter cette base de données.
En lien avec les équipes de gestion d’actifs, vous interviendrez également en tant que support aux activités de marché, afin de faciliter la transmission entre le Front Office et le Back Office :
Automatiser le traitement des opérations de marché et optimiser les processus associés : tickets d’opérations, alimentation des cahiers d’ordres, transmission des informations au back office, etc.
Mettre en place un contrôle automatique des opérations.
Automatiser des calculs de performance sur différentes classes d’actifs ou différents produits financiers.
Connaissances et compétences
De formation BAC + 4/5 en école d’ingénieur ou équivalent universitaire avec une spécialisation en statistique & informatique, vous disposez d’une bonne maîtrise de la gestion et de la présentation des données, de la modélisation décisionnelle et du langage SQL.
Vous devrez faire preuve d’une parfaite maîtrise d’Excel (formules avancées, VBA, CSV), avoir des notions sur Access et une bonne connaissance de la création de rapports / utilisation des univers dans le logiciel SAP BO (une connaissance de SAS Enterprise Guide sera appréciée).
Une appétence pour les marchés financiers et les différentes classes d’actifs (actions, obligations, OPCVM) seront également appréciées pour ce poste.
Merci de transmettre votre candidature à Françoise VALLEAUX : francoise.valleaux@acm.fr
Savoir-être - savoir-faire
Rigueur, sens de la méthode, précision et réactivité.
Goût du travail en équipe : vous serez amené à interagir avec différentes équipes et devrez disposer de qualités relationnelles essentielles à la réalisation de votre mission.
Retour

Alkemics connects brands and retailers to help them market & sell their products everywhere, driving business growth, by allowing them to collect, enrich, and share product data across the retail ecosystem.
Our mission is to connect every brand with every retailer in the world. Our platform streamlines the management of digital product content (i.e., packaging, ingredients, visuals, promotions, rich media), extracts structured metadata for optimal quality and usability, and automates delivery to retail partners and third party service providers.
Founded in 2011, and backed by world renowned investors (Index Ventures, Serena Capital, Cathay Innovation, Partech Ventures, among others), Alkemics consists of 70+ talented employees, and has offices in the very heart of Paris.
Our startup culture allows for very flat hierarchy, and for everyone, regardless of seniority, to have a big impact. We are looking to continue building a kickass team, so if you're looking for a new challenge, give us a sign!

At Alkemics, every day is different, but your main missions will include:

Within the Interop Team, your role as Data Operations Analyst will be key in the helping the support of big-scale projects.

Your main mission will be to participate in building and maintaining the Alkemics data model.

Your main tasks will include:
Create attributes and referentials for the platform
Review fields in existing industries to ensure we cover all business needs expressed by our clients
Manage contextual information in order to guide the user on the platform (e.g. labels of fields)
Update and write internal documentation about decisions made on the data model
Gain in datamodel expertise in order to answer support questions
Requirements
What we're looking for in you:
Excellent follow-through skills
Excellent analytical mindset, excellent organisational skills with a focus on prioritisation, good at process design and analysis
Good knowledge on how to browse and search for informations on databases
Good level of French and English
Curious about the Tech sphere, any technical knowledge is a plus
Benefits

You will participate to the team's growth and the revolution of the CPG industry
A fast-learning curve with growing responsibilities
Pushing the limits: through semantic analysis and machine learning to solve complex problems in the FMCG industry
Working with dynamic, smart and passionate people
Extras: weekly sport sessions, meditation, hackathons, team offsites, lunch sessions.

Mettre à jour et diffuser quotidiennement les indicateurs de suivi de la production
Etablir et communiquer les objectifs journaliers à atteindre pour chaque zone en production et en assurer le suivi (Production monitoring)

Stuart45 avis - Paris (75)
titre_poste: Operations Data Analyst Intern (new business unit)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Stuart is Europe’s leading on-demand logistics platform which connects businesses to a fleet of geolocalised couriers. Our platform allows businesses big and small in every industry to deliver to their customers with never-seen-before speed and efficiency.
In 2017, just 2 years from launch, Europe’s biggest logistics company GeoPost (Groupe La Poste) acquired Stuart so that it could join prestigious companies like DPD, Colissimo, SEUR & Chronopost and conquer urban logistics.
With an exciting blend of GeoPost Group expertise and a fun, agile start up culture, Stuart has expanded to more than 90 cities across France, the UK & Spain and continued the steep growth curve it has become accustomed to.
What really makes Stuart tick though, is the 200+ people that work here every day to smash our goals. We are a free-thinking, enthusiastic bunch whether it’s sales or operations people, engineers or designers.
We’re passionate about looking at problems in fresh and innovative ways – every problem is just opportunity for a great solution. We love to invent new ways of doing things and come to work every day with smiles on our faces.
Want to be a part of this revolution? We are currently looking for an Operations Data Analyst Intern who is responsible for deep analyses and reliable process automations. His ultimate goal is to keep the best in-class client & courier experience despite our massive development. You are fan of finding creative ideas looking at numbers? Then you are the perfect person for our operations team!
You will mainly work with the French Operations but every day you will have the chance to contribute to the success of Stuart by helping all the teams driving the business and proposing new ideas.
Build and improve automation processes in order to focus every day on the most important aspects.
Improve Stuart metrics by analysing day-to-day business evolution. We always welcome new ideas that help us growing even faster
Help improve the pricing policy and the courier incentive strategies to ensure long-term success
Build KPI dashboards and closely monitor the platform’s performance
You will have a particular focus on the launch of a new activity

Job Description

Why join us?
Among BlaBlaCar’s core ambitions is launching a new business line that is set to fuel tremendous growth for the company.
As Revenue Management and Pricing Analyst, your mission is to maximize the businesses' opportunity for revenue and profits. You will be in charge of compiling and analyzing data on our business as well as our competition to keep up with market changes and identify trends
What you will directly contribute to
Compiling and analyzing data on our Bus activity :
Before lines opening : defining the price schedules and the number of seats put up for sale at each price, according to the bus performance observed in the past, the service and the competitive positioning determined by BlaBlaCar
Once the line are open : monitoring lines till the day of departures by analyzing commitments on the buses, competition rates, past bus trips
Studying market and competitors activity as a basis of future pricing strategies
Proposing tool evolutions
Participating in transversal projects for the team (methodology, processes, tools, service…)
Collaborating with Network, Operations, Marketing, Sales teams to ensure optimal pricing

Qualifications

What you will need to be successful
A strong ability to lead analysis based on data
Demonstrate a strong ability in synthesis and organization
Excellent proficiency in Excel (Macro/VBA)
A minimum of 3 years of experience in revenue management and pricing
A prior experience in VBA development would be a plus
Enjoy working as a team-player and learning from others

Additional Information

A few practical details about the role
Start: As soon as you are ready!
Location: Paris
Contract: Permanent contract (CDI)
Compensation: Competitive package based on experience
What we offer all of our employees
The opportunity to have a meaningful impact, building a CO2-saving global travel network enabling strong human connections too.
A strong “Fun & Serious” company culture
An international environment with a team counting 35 nationalities, serving a global member-base from 8 offices around the world (Berlin, Kiev, Madrid, Milan, Moscow, Paris (HQ), São Paulo, Warsaw)
State-of-the-art office spaces, in a great location
A start-up spirit grounded in agility & teamwork
Challenging career opportunities in a high-growth and fast-paced environment
Bi-Weekly team-all BlaBlaTalks to learn from each other
Weekly Tech Demos, so that we’re all up to date with where our product stands
And some other great perks!
Free carpooling to live our value “Be The Member”.
Annual BlaBlaBreak which takes us all for an unforgettable weekend
Possibility to work from another BlaBlaOffice abroad for a week once a year (BlaBlaSwap)

What is next

If you are ready to join our exciting journey, please apply below: upload your resume in English (PDF format) and answer our questions in English.
Kindly note that only complete applications will be reviewed by our hiring team and that all your information will be kept confidential.
You can expect us to review your application within the following 3 weeks. If your application and profile fit our requirements, we will invite you for a quick call, followed by a in person interview and a case study.
BlaBlaCar is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Market Analysts / Data Scientists : assurer l’applicabilité opérationnelle des outils de Machine Learning et participer à l’amélioration des modèles.
Filiales : mutualiser les travaux de suivi des performances de nos jeux et le déploiement de nouveaux outils.

Modéliser/optimiser des outils et processus au sein d’un secteur en rapide évolution (Digitalisation, Free-to-Play, nouvelles plateformes…) afin d’aider le management à la prise de décisions stratégiques
Accompagner l’industrialisation de la collecte et la diffusion de données de ventes et de comportement des joueurs.
Participer activement aux projets métiers ou informatiques visant à améliorer le potentiel analytique de l’entreprise.

Forte capacité d'analyse / Synthèse
Autonomie / Force de proposition
Grande rigueur dans les analyses et la construction de modèles
Bonne compréhension du marché du jeu vidéo et des comportements des joueurs
Qualités relationnelles pour interagir avec les autres entités du Groupe

Forrester - Paris (75)

description:
Overview
Fuel your intellectual curiosity and professional growth. Forrester is an idea company, where smart, motivated, curious people bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on ideas that change the course of business. Most of all, bring a point of view; here, every voice has value. At Forrester, you’ll work with innovative clients at emerging and established brands; these are the business and technology leaders we inspire and who inspire us. The Forrester experience is built on a singular, powerful purpose: to challenge thinking and lead change.
About This Role:
Forrester Leadership Boards offer senior-level technology and marketing leaders an exclusive network of peers, analysts, and advisors to share, challenge, and co-create best practices to lead change in their organizations. The technology council brings technology leaders together to understand emerging technologies and solve their most pressing challenges. Forrester works with these clients to address their business problems by connecting them with Forrester’s research and insights as well as with a community of peers.

It is the role of a Senior Advisor to interface almost continuously with technology leaders, to foster deep and trusted relationships and apply Forrester resources and peer community recommendations to meet their most pressing challenges. Senior Advisors diagnose, together with the client, their underlying business challenges and leverage their own deep knowledge of best practices to deliver valuable insights. Senior Advisors may well suggest a client pivots and takes an alternative approach, based on what they now has worked for others, or to avoid making the mistakes of those who have previously tried and failed.

As a Senior Advisor for the technology council, you will display a high degree of competency in the business acumen, client management, technology strategy, business development, and cross-functional collaboration. You understand and can speak with fluency about the challenges technology leaders face in the age of the customer and are excited to partner with them in solving their business problems.
Responsibilities
Serve, retain, and grow the technology council’s peer network across Europe.
Proactively engage your book of clients, building strong knowledge of their role, key objectives, and ongoing activities.
Connect Forrester’s research, insights, and tools as well as insights from the peer community and your own experience to help clients solve their most pressing business challenges.
Operate as an extension of your clients’ teams, providing relevant, timely insights that make a real impact on their key initiatives.
Sense patterns across client needs to inform council agendas and contribute to the development of high-quality content.
Contribute to innovation of councils based on client feedback and observed patterns of client needs.
Build and manage strong partnerships with sales, research, consulting, and clients to renew and grow the revenue of your council.
Qualifications
BA or BS degree with a strong academic record; an MBA or other advanced degree is a plus.
Ten-plus years of experience, ideally in technology consulting with progressive technology exposure or within an internal technology delivery function.
Experience with key challenges and opportunities facing senior technology professionals, in particular, for application development and delivery leaders and/or sourcing and vendor management leaders, as well as their adjacent roles.
Demonstrable understanding of enterprise-wide technology strategy and customer experience imperatives. Builds credibility with clients as a trusted partner.
Demonstrable track record of business development and a keen interest in expanding Forrester’s technology leader community across Europe.
High level of executive credibility and presence, with superior verbal, written, facilitation, and formal presentation skills.
Advanced critical thinking and structured problem-solving skills.
The ability to lead effective and valuable one-on-one and group interactions that address clear objectives, deliver meaningful insights, and challenge thinking where appropriate.
Ability to manage ambiguous situations across diverse cultures.
Client-focused and committed to delivering high quality in all aspects of the work.
Fluency in multiple European languages is highly preferred.
Willingness to travel up to four weeks per quarter.

Forrester Research is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a work environment that is free from all forms of discrimination, including sexual harassment.

Data Protection

The information provided by you in this application will be used for the purposes of recruitment and, for successful applicants only, for personnel administration and management purposes and to comply with the employer’s obligations regarding the retention of employee records. If your application is unsuccessful, Forrester Research, Inc., its subsidiaries, affiliates, and/or service providers (collectively “Forrester”) will retain your personal information on secure file solely to consider you for future recruitment opportunities.

By submitting your resume/CV, you consent to Forrester’s retention of the information provided on a secure file for personnel administration and management purposes and/or in order to consider you for future employment opportunities and to the transfer of the information provided to:

Forrester’s offices in the US and other countries outside the European Economic Area; and Service providers engaged by Forrester for the purposes of processing applications for employment who may be located outside the European Economic Area.
